Class Row

  • java.lang.Object
    • Row

  • public class Row
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a single row of chips.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Row(int numChipsToStart)
      constructor that starts this row off with a given number of chips.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean hasNChipsAvaliable(int N)
      indicates whether there are at least N chips remaining in this row
      boolean isEmpty()
      indicates whether this is an empty row
      void removeNChips(int N)
      decreases the number of chips in this row by N.
      java.lang.String toString()
      gives a sequence of stars, corresponding to how many chips there are.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        indicates whether this is an empty row
        Returns:
        (true/false) whether the row is currently empty.

      • hasNChipsAvaliable

        public boolean hasNChipsAvaliable(int N)
        indicates whether there are at least N chips remaining in this row
        Parameters:
        N - - the minimum number of chips we are asking about
        Returns:
        whether there are at least N chips. (true/false)

      • removeNChips

        public void removeNChips(int N)
        decreases the number of chips in this row by N.
        Parameters:
        N - - how many chips to remove.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        gives a sequence of stars, corresponding to how many chips there are. For example, if there are 4 stars, this will return "****".
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
